Race.SpecificTitle: Constable -- 2nd Justice of the Peace Court
City of Thibodaux Prop. No. 1 of 4 -- Amend HRC Art. III, Sec. 4 - CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of Thibodaux Proposition No. 1 of 4
(Charter Amendment)
Race.FullText: Shall Article III, Section 4 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of Thibodaux be amended as set forth in Ordinance No. 3127 adopted by the Thibodaux City Council on March 2, 2021, to provide that the Mayor and members of the City Council shall take office on the second Monday in January following their election?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Thibodaux Prop. No. 2 of 4 -- Amend HRC Art. IV, Sec. 6(A) - CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of Thibodaux Proposition No. 2 of 4
(Charter Amendment)
Race.FullText: Shall Article IV, Section 6(A) of the Home Rule Charter of the City of Thibodaux be amended as set forth in Ordinance No. 3127 adopted by the Thibodaux City Council on March 2, 2021 to modify the process by which members may be nominated to the Civil Service Board?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Thibodaux Prop. No. 3 of 4 -- 1.83 Mills Renewal - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Thibodaux Proposition No. 3 of 4
(Fire Department Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Thibodaux, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of one and eighty-three hundredths (1.83) mills on all the property subject to taxation in said City (an estimated $237,600 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the fire department facilities of said City?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Thibodaux Prop. No. 4 of 4 -- 2.74 Mills Renewal - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Thibodaux Proposition No. 4 of 4
(Street Millage Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Thibodaux, State of Louisiana (the "City"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of two and seventy-four hundredths (2.74) mills on all the property subject to taxation in said City (an estimated $355,800 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years beginning with the year 2023 and ending with the year 2032, for the purpose of the maintenance of the public streets, roads and alleys within the City?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Protection District No. 8-B -- $75.00 Parcel Fee - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 8-B Proposition
(Parcel Fee)
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 8-B of the Parish of Lafourche, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect annually for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2022, a fee of Seventy-Five Dollars ($75.00) on each lot, subdivided portion of ground or individual tract upon which is located, either in whole or in part, a residential or commercial structure, regardless of the structure's being occupied or unoccupied, and each improved portion of ground upon which a residential or commercial structure has been or may be situated and to which a mailing address has been assigned by a local governmental subdivision, a landowner, or a lessor (an estimated $27,675 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the parcel fee for an entire year), for acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating fire protection facilities and equipment and all purposes incidental thereto, including salaries of firemen, in accordance with La. R.S. 40:1505, as amended?
